head.title: A Stork Club Reminiscence Brings Out the Memories

hedline.hl1: A Stork Club Reminiscence Brings Out the Memories

abstract.p: Lou D'Angelo letter on Patricia Bosworth's April 30 article on New York City's famed Stork Club (S)

block.p: Re: ''I Was a Hatcheck Girl at the Stork'' (First Person, April 30): When I was growing up in East Harlem, the Stork Club was the epitome of glamorous Gotham. I remember gazing in awe at an ashtray bearing its name, which one of my relatives had apparently filched. But during the McCarthy era, I came to regard the place differently, turned off by Walter Winchell's sycophancies about his unpleasant friends.

Re: ''I Was a Hatcheck Girl at the Stork'' (First Person, April 30): When I was growing up in East Harlem, the Stork Club was the epitome of glamorous Gotham. I remember gazing in awe at an ashtray bearing its name, which one of my relatives had apparently filched. But during the McCarthy era, I came to regard the place differently, turned off by Walter Winchell's sycophancies about his unpleasant friends.
I'm looking forward to the New-York Historical Society recreation of the place, since I never made it to the real one. In the meantime, I'm grateful for Patricia Bosworth's colorful recollections.
